snippet: Micah Johnson had practiced explosive detonations, the city’s police chief said, providing new details of how Mr. Johnson sang, laughed and taunted officers during negotiations....
abstract: Authorities conclude Micah Johnson, gunman who killed five police officers at protest in Dallas, was planning more attacks after finding bomb-making materials and other evidence in his home; Chief David O Brown, on CNN's State of the Union, offers details from two hours of negotiations, in which gunman sang, laughed and mocked officers.

byline.original: By ALAN BLINDER and TIMOTHY WILLIAMS
byline.contributor: Alan Blinder reported from Dallas, and Timothy Williams from New York. Reporting was contributed by Dave Montgomery and Manny Fernandez from Dallas; Campbell Robertson and Christiaan Mader from Baton Rouge, La.; Mark Landler from Madrid; Samantha Schmidt and Annie Correal from New York; and Nicholas Fandos from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Micah Johnson had practiced explosive detonations, the city’s police chief said, providing new details of how Mr. Johnson sang, laughed and taunted officers during negotiations.

headline.main: Dallas Gunman Had Plans for Wider Attack, Police Say
headline.print_headline: Dallas Gunman Planned Larger Attack, Chief Says

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dallas, Tex, Shooting of Police Officers (2016)
